data.title: A bagel with anything including salted caramel spread
data.text:
This is primarily a breakfast/ lunch place.  It is tiny with about 3 seats in the window and 4 folding chairs outside.  The bagels are wonderful.  I got an (organic) egg and cheese on an everything bagel. Yummmm!  I wasn't very hungry but I ate the whole thing.  For take out it came wrapped in foil - a fried egg with melted sharp cheese between the toasted bagel slices.  It was not dry or drippy or gooey.  It was just the way I like my finger food - edible but not messy.  This was a better bagel than I'd had in a long time. It appears that everything is prepared on site. 

They had 3 people on staff that morning at about 9am.  The window seats were full and people were flowing in at a handleable rate.  I waited about 5-7 minutes for my bagel and others waited less for more simple orders.  The waiting area is a bit tight but it would be fine during warmer weather when the doors are open.  There is plenty of reading material posted on the front of the counter to keep one occupied during the wait time.  

I don't usually eat wheat or dairy but I may make an exception for this.

data.title: Great breakfast stop.
data.text: We decided on stopping by after reading about Union Bagel on Tripadvisor.  The store is in a small building and is very unassuming.  If I hadn't read the reviews, I would not have stopped, but I'm glad we did.  I got a breakfast sandwich and it was fantastic.  From the variety of bagels, to the variety of shmears, this little stop had it all.  I will definitely go back again when we go back to Portland.

data.title: Good bagels
data.text: Great shop with really good bagels and a nice variety of spreads. The scallion cream cheese is very good. Place can get busy so be patient.

data.title: Great Lox Sandwich
data.text: Wonderfully chewy and crisp everything bagel, homemade scallion cream cheese, lox, onion, capers, tomato, spinach and cucumber means a delicious and quick way to brunch in Portland. Great coffee too! Innovative approach to egg and cheese and very friendly staff. Worth straying from old port and the west end for these bagels.

data.title: Tiny space packed with love!
data.text: Best bagels! Try the lox & capers with red onion; def my fav 😋. They are super friendly, knowledgeable about events in the area, and have a great product to boot.

data.title: Ess-A-Bagel
data.text: No, it's not ess-a-bagel (Yiddish for "eat a bagel") - hailing from NYC I too love their bagels - but Union Bagels is second to none in this slighted jaded New Yorkers opinion.  Add a fabulous and friendly staff - on top of authentic and, yes, delicious bagels - and Portland, Maine can clearly and proudly boast of a fantastic bagel.  Plain and simple.

data.title: Best Bagels North of New York City
data.text:
and, while that might not count for much when you consider the things some places call bagels between NY and Portland, this place could seriously hold its own in NY. THESE ARE GREAT BAGELS, PEOPLE! crunchy bottoms, chewy insides and just the right resistance from the top. Plus, they are usually warm and thus frighteningly addictive, particularly the everything and the salt bagels, which just beg for more still 
MORE cream cheese. If God invented bagels in Maine, then he invented them here.

data.title: Bagels!! Authentic!! In Maine!!
data.text: What?!?! It's true! Deliciously crisp outside with the customary chewy inside created only by the true and traditional cooking method of poaching before baking. Decadent "smears" (which is anything BUT scant to say the least) of numerous cream cheese flavors. Try their special: Bread & Roses: your choice of cream cheese, Maine lox, all the veggies, olive oil, salt and pepper.  You will not be disappointed. Service is friendly and casual. Totally worth the wait in line (which extends out the door because the space is small so dress warm in the winter). What a welcome find. We can't wait until the next trip into town for another visit to Union Bagel. I'm going for a Bialy next time!

data.title: Need to try it Again
data.text: I showed up just before 7 on the 14th to try their bialy’s, since I was born and raised on the island (yes from away). They were not quite ready so they reserved 8 of them for me and I went back in 20 minutes later. I think they really needed about 10 more minutes or so in the oven. The bialy’s needed to rise a bit more since when I sliced them at home there was that hollowed out part from the onions. Plus the onions need to be chopped up finer. I will take the blame for them, since I think they rushed them a bit for me. I did get 8 other mixed bagels and they were perfect with excellent flavor and a nice chew. The cream cheese choices cover the whole universe….so yes I will be back. I also enjoyed talking with the crew working that morning at this bagel oasis on the hill.

data.title: Best bagels in Portland (but not quite up the level of Ess a Bagel in New York)
data.text: Subject says it -- great bagels.  They have a range of spreads, or you get get a modestly priced bagel with real smoked salmon.  There's space for a few people to eat standing up.  That it, but we love it!

data.title: tasty
data.text: tasty bagels, nice friendly service and a really cute place.  Good variety too because I love lots of seeds and stuff on them.

data.title: Best Bagels!!
data.text: I go here every time I get a chance to come to Portland. The bagels are delicious and traditional. The cream cheese options are of a wide variety, as well as the other topping choices. The coffee is delicious and locally sourced! It's a perfect place to grab-and-go. Service is always with a smile, and you can actually see the bagels being made right in front of your eyes. Great spot, great people.

data.title: Tasty bagels
data.text: We got bagels to go for our hike in Pleasant Mountain. We had the bagels with lox, red onion, tomatoes, greens, capers & cream cheese. The bagel was fresh & chewy. The lox with all the other toppings were delicous. The staff was very friendly. They open early & free street parking.

data.title: great organic grain bagels.  really good lox
data.text: fun place who efficiently serves the line out the door.  worth the wait for great fresh made bagels with generous cream cheese.

data.title: Good bagels
data.text: As other reviewers have noted, these are definitely good bagels that don't leave you feeling bloated (or bad about your calorie choices). The space is very small and warm, so plan to head out for a many picnic to enjoy them.

data.title: The best bagels ever ... do NOT miss this ...
data.text: We are from New York City, and my wife makes the best bagels ever ... but she was simply blown away by this experience ... this is a master bagel maker !

data.title: Yum
data.text: This place is very unique and the quality of your food is absolutely remarkable. I love it here. First stop of the day or anytime you will forever be pleased

data.title: Skip Starbucks and hit this place
data.text: We walked to this place two days in a row from the hotel The first day we had stopped at Starbucks in town first and eyed the defrosted bagels. I am so glad that we went the extra half mile to this place. I got an onion bagel, toasted with cream cheese and salmon locks. Just an incredibly good bagel served by really great people.

data.title: Fresh, fresh, fresh (did I mention fresh?)
data.text: Dedicated to their craft as they show up at 3 a.m. to start the process of making these tasty delights! Try an Everything bagel or the sumptuous salt! Nice, friendly and beyond reasonable prices. Sooooooo lucky to have them in Portland!

data.title: Great bagel, nice people
data.text: This is my favorite Sunday morning stop to cure a night of fun! Coffee is delicious, warm and fresh. I love the delicious bagels of all kinds, and the customer service is great. The price is very fair for the product.
